channel.title: mecab on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in mecab on Memo Tut

item.title: Made a Chrome extension to drive out dark sites from the world with the power of natural language processing
item.description: #Motivation Coronavirus pandemic is all the dark news these days… :pensive: →If you only see the bright news, you will feel positive! Made A Chrome extension that makes Google search results less visible as the content is darker. Chrome Store: Opty github Actual screen Dark site Bright site How to use Just install the Chrome extension from here and search!

item.title: Introduction of ALBERT (using MeCab+Sentencepiece) model that learned large-scale Japanese business news corpus
item.description: #Introduction Previously, Japanese BERT pre-learned modelandXLNetpre-learnedmodel It is the stockmark Morinaga who posted the introduction articles such as. Thank you for reading the article on model release to many people. This time, we will release the pre-learned Japanese model of ALBERT. Now, while various pre-learned models have been proposed, why do you publish ALBERT Japanese model?ALBERT is not just SOTA as described as A Lite BERT , Because it is a model that makes the BERT lighter while maintaining and improving accuracy.

item.title: How to insert NEologd dictionary in Windows relatively easily-system dictionary
item.description: #Introduction I used WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux)+Ubuntu to install the NEologd dictionary for MeCab morphological analysis, but it was relatively easy to install with git for Windows and 7-zip. Since I wrote about user dictionaries in the previous article ↓, this time it is the system dictionary. https://qiita.com/zincjp/items/c61c441426b9482b5a48 #environment Windows10 64bit Language: Japanese MeCab 0.996-32bit What to introduce git for Windows 2.20.1 64-bit 7-Zip 18.06 64-bit #Introduction procedure

item.title: What I found out by analyzing the word-of-mouth on the career change site! ?
item.description: #Introduction I am currently conducting research activities under the theme of “How can I enjoy my work?” I think that collecting tips from companies will give you some hints, so let’s try data analysis! #Environment macOS Mojave Python 3.7.4 Google Chrome 79.0.3945.79 ChromeDriver 79.0.3945.36 selenium 3.141.0 mecab-python3 0.996.2 #Scraping Before implementing, check the scraping precautions. Web scraping precaution list-Qiita Refer to the following articles to prepare the necessary tools.

item.title: I tried summarizing what was output with Qiita with Word cloud
item.description: This is the 10th article from the Proto Out Studio Advent Calendar! #Overview After entering the Proto-Out Studio, I started to output with Qiita. (Although it is still very few) So, this time, I also looked back on what I wrote so far, I want to visualize what I have output in Word Cloud of Python. About Word Cloud WordCloud is to select words with a high frequency of occurrence from the text and to display them in a size according to the frequency of occurrence of the words.

item.title: Since it's the 20th anniversary of formation, I tried to visualize the lyrics of Perfume with WordCloud
item.description: ![perfume.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/208648/d746d185-2dfb-ec8f-5029-82794ed0afc1.png) This article is the sixth day of estie Advent Calendar 2019. I am an engineer at a real estate venture estie.inc. #Introduction This article has been a hot topic recently! [Python] I visualized Arashi’s lyrics in WordCloud and tried to figure out what I wanted to tell the fans in 20 years since formation It makes me really happy when my favorite idols and artists are active and loved for many years.
